definition[0]: a situation in which someone owes more money on a mortgage (=arrangement to borrow money to pay for a house) than they would receive if they sold their house
definition[1]: when an asset, usually property, bought by a borrower with a loan is worth less than the loan remaining to be paid
example[0]: the growing number of home owners with negative equity
definition[2]: when a companyâ€™s liabilities are more than its assets
example[1]: The level of bad debts at some Thai banks may mean that some have negative equity.
